question: I am a type 1 diabetic that recently went from controlling my BS with approx 1U per 10g carb ratio to probably 1U per 5g carbs.  I am very healthy aside from the diabetes and excercise frequently. I was officially diagnosed about a year ago but from the results of all the tests run my specialist feels that I was diabetic much longer than that, but keeping it somewhat under control due to lots of exercise and the fact that I don't have a high carb intake.  I would have thought I was past the honeymoon phase due to my tests reflecting beta cell function and how much insulin I could naturally produce was near non existent. I feel ok besides a very mild stuffy nose and was wondering if I could feel fine but be fighting an infection I don't know about yet? Would that affect my BS control that significantly? This is. the first time I have been just a tiny bit sick since my diagnosis
title: Sudden increase in insulin needs?
